intro: Verbascum majale proles conocarpum, commonly known as the woolly flax or mullein, is a flowering plant belonging to the Scrophulariaceae family. It is characterized by its tall, erect stem covered in soft, fuzzy hairs, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces showy yellow or orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Verbascum majale proles conocarpum is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally for its soothing effects on respiratory ailments.
